title: Lucian and Lux, behind the name:
body:
The latin root "Lux, Luc" means "Light"
Which makes sense for Lux, who is "The Lady of Luminosity" and whos whole kit revolves around light.
Also Lucian who weilds weapons of light, like his passive light slinger.
"Luc" meaning light and the suffix "ician" meaning specialist. 
making Lucian a "Light Specialist"

Now, did you guys notice any more words hidden in champion names? :) post them in the comments!

Some from my favourite champions:

{{champion:111}} , not only is it the name of a species of shellfish that's been around for millions of years, Nautilus in the English language is a latin adaptation of a greek word, that word meaning sailor. Nautilus himself was a sailor before his transformation.

{{champion:267}} Nami is of course Japanese in origin and means wave. Tsunami, her ultimate, would be derived from ami (wave) and Tsu, which is its own character.

{{champion:161}} Vel'Koz's name is weird. In the lore his name is probably Shuriman in origin like most other Voidborn names, but in the real world Vel and Koz are two words that have a lot of religious connotations. Vel is the name of a divine javelin wielded by a Hindu God named Karthikeya, while Koz refers to Descendants of Judah in the Bible. Apparently.

A friend who didnt play league at the time and i were talking and i told her a champions name was Lux, and she was like "that means light in Latin." and it blew my fuckin mind because i knew lux was a light mage.
She's not a light mage, she's just an ordinary mage.

Please don't troll, her kit is literally about using light to attack people, her lore specifically says she is adept at light magic, and her title is "the Lady of Luminosity" and Luminosity means Light energy.
Please don't  troll, [Lux does not identify as a light mage.](http://images.wikia.com/leagueoflegends/images/f/f0/Lux.joke3.ogg)
Um, that is a blank tab, what are you on about?
Reload the page a few times. Otherwise, save the file and listen to it.

I'm pretty sure the point of that is *irony*, because she is in fact a light mage, but she is using it as a pun in that she isn't a light mage (referring to physical weight, sort of like a lightweight boxer) but a normal mage (she hits just as hard as any other mage does).
You are reading too much into her quote with this light-boxer-light-mage analogy. I ask that you not take her words lightly as if it were a joke and that you respect her magical orientation.

How is saying a joke is supposed to be funny reading into things too much?

I'm still wondering if you are just trying to troll me out on this really hard...
One of Lux's jokes is her saying that she's not a light mage, just an ordinary mage.  It's Touhou reference.

Did it by any chance occur to you that the intended purpose of her joke is a pun? I don't know if it is a reference to whatever Touhou is, but it is supposed to be funny because it is *ironic* due to the fact that she is actually a light mage (otherwise it wouldn't be a joke).

Could be that was the joke.  But that was specifically a thing that Marisa Kirisame (a light mage) from Touhou said.  Also if you know who Shurelia is you'd know that she was all about jamming references in League, especially ones about Touhou. See Youmuu's Ghost blade, Wriggle's Lantern and the name of Lux's ultimate.

Whatever the case may be I'm glad you've seemed to have accepted that that is indeed the joke she makes and you are no longer confused about what ExHentai said.
